User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/13.0.782.32 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:

I am a network/e-mail assistant working for MSU. In recent attempts to move our users to Thunderbird 5, we are encountering inconsistencies in the outgoing server settings that the Autoconfiguration utility pulls from the ISPDB. I found our record in there, which was submitted on 2010-01-05. It is still listed as pending, so we were hoping to get our result published soon. The file is listed here (everything is correct) but I have also attached an .xml file: http://ispdb.mozillamessaging.com/details/152. The developer page also suggests requesting approval from bwinton, gozer or ben.bucksch.

A more direct URL for our listing is also: http://techbase.msu.edu/article.asp?id=13585


Actual results:

Outgoing server suggested using port 587/STARTTLS.


Expected results:

The correct outgoing server settings for mail.msu.edu are port 465, security type SSL.
